# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(words, text_width::Int=10)
    lines = []
    current_line = ""
    
    for word in words
        if length(current_line) + length(word) > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = word
        else
            current_line *= " " * word
        end
    end
    
    push!(lines, current_line)
    return join(lines, "\n")
end

words = ["Julia", "is", "a", "high-level", "programming", "language"]
println(wrap_string(words))
```

The function `wrap_string` wraps words into lines of a maximum length specified by `text_width`. In the example, we create an array `words` with some text, and then print the wrapped string using the `wrap_string` function.
